item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 29, 2025 at 1:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Gurus of 90s Web Design: Zeldman, Siegel, Nielsen (174 points | 62 comments)
2. My website is ugly because I made it (121 points | 30 comments)
3. Simple programming language with offline usable browser IDE (27 points | 6 comments)

6. Show HN: I made a Zero-config tool to visualize your code (35 points | 19 comments)
7. They used Xenon to climb Everest in days – is it the future of mountaineering? (69 points | 112 comments)
8. From Finite Integral Domains to Finite Fields (31 points | 4 comments)

10. High-quality OLED displays now enabling integrated thin and multichannel audio (70 points | 43 comments)
11. Run a C# file directly using dotnet run app.cs (166 points | 131 comments)
12. Long live American Science and Surplus (322 points | 82 comments)
13. I taught my 3-year-old to read like a 9-year-old (37 points | 24 comments)
14. The MAHA Report Cites Studies That Don't Exist (33 points | 14 comments)

16. A toy RTOS inside Super Mario Bros. using emulator save states (219 points | 49 comments)
17. Japan Post launches 'digital address' system (367 points | 246 comments)
18. Chimps strike stones against trees as communication, study suggests (59 points | 11 comments)
19. RSyncUI – A SwiftUI based macOS GUI for rsync (47 points | 12 comments)
20. Compiler Explorer and the promise of URLs that last forever (316 points | 148 comments)
21. HTAP is Dead (130 points | 63 comments)
22. Walkers' Sensations Poppadoms vs. HMRC: The Chip of Theseus (9 points | 4 comments)
23. What If We Had Bigger Brains? Imagining Minds Beyond Ours (156 points | 188 comments)
24. Visualize and debug Rust programs with a new lens (192 points | 27 comments)
25. Can Open Source Projects Exit Foundations? (43 points | 35 comments)
26. What does “Undecidable” mean, anyway (119 points | 118 comments)
27. Compiling a neural net to C for a speedup (259 points | 83 comments)
28. What programmers should know about how CPUs work [video] (31 points | 1 comment)
29. Show HN: Tesseral – Open-Source Auth (177 points | 60 comments)
30. Apollo Lunar Surface Journal (34 points | 6 comments)
